meanings.definition: To establish control over (a country or people) as a colony.
meanings.sent1: The powerful nation colonializes weaker lands to expand its influence.
meanings.sent2: The explorers colonialize new territories in search of resources.
meanings.sent3: The history book humorously describes how the empire colonializes distant lands.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style colonializes the team, guiding them towards success.
meanings.sent5: The documentary vividly portrays how one nation colonializes another for economic gain.

meanings.definition: To settle among and establish control over (indigenous people).
meanings.sent1: The settlers colonialize the native tribes, introducing new customs.
meanings.sent2: The missionaries colonialize remote villages to spread their beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show jokingly depicts how aliens colonialize Earth.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness colonializes the hearts of the local community.
meanings.sent5: The novel paints a vivid picture of how outsiders colonialize a peaceful island.
